title: Relates to instruction on the history of people with disabilities
summary: Relates to instruction on the history of people with disabilities.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         2352

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                   I N  S E N A T E

                                   January 19, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by Sen. GRISANTI -- read twice and ordered printed, and when
         printed to be committed to the Committee on Education

       AN ACT to amend the education law, in relation  to  instruction  on  the
         history of people with disabilities

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Subdivision 5 of section 801 of the education law, as added
    2  by chapter 265 of the laws of 2000, is amended to read as follows:
    3    5. The regents shall make available to all  elementary  AND  SECONDARY
    4  schools  in  the  state  suitable  curriculum  materials  to  aid in the
    5  instruction of pupils in grades kindergarten through [six] TWELVE in the
    6  understanding and acceptance of children with disabilities as defined in
    7  section forty-four hundred one of this chapter.
    8    S 2. This act shall take effect on the first of July  next  succeeding
    9  the  date  on  which  it shall have become a law, and shall apply to all
   10  school years which commence on or after its effective date.






        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD06862-01-1
actClause: AN ACT to amend the education law, in relation to instruction on the history of people with disabilities
